resources.string: It may be the name of the library, but the Spotlight is optional. There will be some Spotlights later, after these other features.

A fluent interface simplifies producing Scripts with multiple Scenes:

%s

The Script is the primary interface to the library. Adding Scenes to the Script adds new screens to the tutorial, and adding an Actor to a Scene will place a spotlight on the display.

A hard cut is the default transition, but a fade is also available. This Scene was presented with a two-second fade. The default duration for transitions is the system \"short\" animation duration.\n\nBecause transitions are associated with Scenes, a special empty Scene is used to control transition out of the last Scene. The SceneBuilder\'s end method will add this scene, if a transition is currently enabled.

While most Scene properties are cleared for each new scene - for example, the fade used for the last scene is not repeated for this one - custom layouts and transitions also have setDefault methods that cause the following scenes to reuse a setting. \n\nThe next few Scenes will all use a short fade.

This Scene uses a custom text layout. Any layout that contains TextViews with the same IDs as in the default layout may be used. Custom layouts may be set for the Button and Spotlight as well - for these, the root of the layout must be of the correct type.
The title and detail text are both optional, and the default layout will collapse either if not present.
It\'s about time! The previous examples demonstrated most of the ways that Scenes can be customized, but didn\'t highlight anything. But look, here\'s a kitten!

This certainly is some meaty text. As with the kitten, the Actor for this Scene is a ViewActor with the default configuration, which circumscribes the selected View. The layout for this demo makes it a bit awkward in portrait mode.
ViewActors can also be configured to inscribe the spotlight in the target instead of circumscribing the target. This may be more comfortable for very tall or wide Views.

Scene properties for which defaults can be set also have matching clearDefault methods to restore the normal default behavior. The default transition was cleared before building this scene, restoring the original hard cut transition.
The other Scenes in this demo will only display once, but can be repeated by pressing the \"Show Again\" button.
